docs.lead_paragraph: The police are searching for two women who took a preserved fetus from an exhibit at the California Science Center. The fetus, infused with polymers in a process called plastination to prevent decay, was part of a traveling display titled ''Body Worlds 2: The Anatomical Exhibition of Real Human Bodies.'' A surveillance video showed the women removing the fetus from a display case between 2 a.m. and 3 a.m. on Saturday.

headline.main: National Briefing | West: California: Preserved Fetus Stolen

docs.abstract: California police search for two women who stole preserved fetus from California Science Center exhibit on human anatomy (S)
